content.question: Which of the following would best support Schama’s argument in the first paragraph about the role of Churchill’s speeches in Great Britain’s war effort?

choices.label: Other nations’ leaders during the war also regularly made speeches to their people.
New mass media such as radio greatly expanded the reach of governments’ mobilization efforts.
For almost a full year after the British declaration of war against Germany, there was almost no military action on British soil.
Despite its economic and logistical support for Britain, the United States did not formally join the war against Germany until after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.

content.answer: New mass media such as radio greatly expanded the reach of governments’ mobilization efforts.
